intro: Rudgea longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed rudgea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Rudgea longipes is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests.
